message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you this product. It's a unique opportunity, and I believe it could be very valuable for your business. I'm starting with a price of $1,000,000. Let's see if we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.
I appreciate your offer, Alice. However, $1,000,000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $850,000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it will bring to my business.

Bob, I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I'm willing to work with you. However, $850,000 is significantly lower than my minimum.  Let's split the difference. I'm prepared to offer the product to you for $925,000. This reflects the value of the product and leaves room for a profitable deal for both of us.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice. However, $925,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $875,000 for the product. I believe this is a fair price considering the value it will bring to my business.

Bob, I see we're getting closer. While $875,000 is an improvement, it's still not quite there for me. I'm willing to come down a bit more, but only to $900,000. This reflects a significant compromise on my end, and I hope you'll consider it seriously.

I understand your compromise, Alice, but $900,000 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $875,000 for the product. I believe this is the best compromise for both of us, considering the value it will bring to my business.
